md:
giải nghĩa từ "vindicated" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan.

Vindicated (verb) - được minh oan, được chứng minh là vô tội

* Meaning: to prove that someone is not guilty of a crime or wrongdoing
* Example sentence: The new evidence vindicated the suspect, and he was released from prison.
* Related words: vindication, vindicate, exonerate

Vindicated (adjective) - được minh oan, được chứng minh là vô tội

* Meaning: having been proved to be not guilty of a crime or wrongdoing
* Example sentence: The vindicated man was finally able to rebuild his life after years of false accusations.
* Related words: vindication, vindicate, exonerated

Note: The verb "vindicate" means to prove that someone is not guilty of a crime or wrongdoing, while the adjective "vindicated" describes someone who has been proved to be not guilty.
